item.title: Report X-2024072251
item.description:
Report X-2024072251

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-01T15:14:26+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-11
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE CONTENTS WERE INSPECTED DUE TO A SIMILAR GROUND PACKAGE CAME THROUGH AT THE SAME TIME AND WAS FOUND WITH UNDECLARED CONTENTS. UPON INSPECTION OF THIS AIR PACKAGE, WE FOUND 20 X 12 OUNCE AEROSOL CANS OF FLAMMABLE QUICK CURE MULTI-PURPOSE FOAM SEALANT INSIDE THE BOX. THERE IS A POUCH AFFIXED TO THE OUTER BOX WITH A PACKING SLIP THAT INDICATES LTD QTY HAZMAT, CLASS 2.2, UN1956. THOSE INDICATORS WERE NOT VISIBLE AT THE TIME OF INSPECTION. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS AFFIXED TO THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.description:

  • City: NASHVILLE

  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Spill. Hazmat, Unprocessed. Please note that no OP-900 striped paperwork was found on the package or on spidr. Despite the 96 applied by NCHG, this package has been entered as Unprocessed. Leaking overpack fiberboard box. Two inner fiberboard boxes. Content: two 4 Liter glass bottles of USABlueBook 95% Hexanes, ACS Grade, no. 74091. Total loss of 8L from loose cap closures, despite tape applied to bottle/cap closure.

The fiberboard box contained two metal cans packaged in plastic bags and separated with fiberboard dividers. One of the cans was damaged on the bottom chime causing the release. All contents were place into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report I-2024030011
item.description:
Report I-2024030011

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-27T00:37:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-05
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTH PARK MOTOR LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8964
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On Monday February 5, 2024, at approximately 2:11 pm (CST), a flatbed semi-truck was transporting a mixed load of commercial waste when a fire was reported by the carriers driver. The driver immediately pulled over to the side of the interstate. The incident occurred on Interstate 40 west bound near mile marker 204, near White Bridge Rd in Nashville Tennessee. The Nashville Fire Department responded to the scene and extinguished the fire within minutes of notification. The fire involved a single package on a load of low-level and mixed low-level radioactive waste being shipped for disposal. The package that caught fire consisted of a soft-sided 90 cubic foot (3.5 yd3) multi-layered bag constructed of a 10 oz. geotextile non-woven polypropylene inner liner, with a double 20 mil high density polyethylene (HDPE) inner and outer liners with 4 mm rigid fiberboard in between the two 18 mil HOPE liners, meeting the General Design Criteria (49 CFR 173.410) and shipped in accordance with 49 CFR 173.427(b)(4) as an Exclusive Use Shipment. The waste was being hauled on a flatbed semi-truck that had three separate containers placed on it. The fire was limited to the one soft-sided container towards the rear of the trailer. There was only minimal damage to the exterior of the other two containers (smoke) and no fire damage to the trailer. The items in the affected container consisted of both facility and customer waste with the majority being used personal protective equipment, facility trash, crushed drums, and other miscellaneous waste materials that were being transported to Texas for disposal. The transport vehicle was placarded with Class 7 Radioactive placards. The cause of the fire was not due to any defect or failure with the carriers truck or trailer, or any action of the carriers driver. Within hours, the shipper sent a response team to the incident site to secure the packaging for shipment back to its origin.

item.title: Report E-2024070609
item.description:
Report E-2024070609

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-23
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NNA experienced a release UN1268 Aromatic 150 from a 275-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released to a 10’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor due to a faulty damaged cap. The cap was replaced, and the tote was wiped down. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted area. All impacted absorbents were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered. The fiberboard box contained two metal jerrycans packaged with paper for dunnage. The bottom chime split on one of the jerrycans causing a release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2024071841
item.description:
Report X-2024071841

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-26T18:15:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-17
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box with signs of a release was discovered during the unloading process at the MEMH location. Inside of the fiberboard box was four glass bottles packaged in plastic bags, absorbent material for dunnage and egg crates top/bottom. One of the glass bottles broke spilling the contents inside of the fiberboard box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: One 1-gallon plastic bottle of Statlab Decal Stat, a UN1789 corrosive, leaked from the cap. Approximately two ounces spilled. The outer carton doesn't show any significant damage other than from internal leakage. Two 1-gallon bottles were shipped in a carton for four with paper filler.
